pr_title: [JBPM-9129] Start process without triggering a start node

timeline.message:
[JBPM-9129] Start process without triggering a start node

Added functions to trigger a new process from an arbitrary node.

[JBPM-9129] Start process without triggering a start node

Added functions to trigger a new process from an arbitrary node.
[JBPM-9129] Start process without triggering a start node
[JBPM-9129] Start process without triggering a start node
[JBPM-9129] Start process without triggering a start node

[JBPM-9129] Start process without triggering a start node
[JBPM-9129] Start process without triggering a start node

timeline.bodyText: I think CancelNodeInstanceAction is used in multiple cases, boundary escalation and boundary error events, not sure I grasp the meaning of TIMED cancel type in this context?
timeline.author: krisv

replies.bodyText: You are right. I can use SKIPPED vs OBSOLETE. OBSOLETE means the task has no meaning anymore as the group it belonged is already completted. SKIPPED would mean that another route has been taking.
replies.author: elguardian

timeline.bodyText: What's the point of passing wfp here, isn't this always this?
timeline.author: krisv

timeline.bodyText: Node instances are stored as part of the binary state using protobuf, wouldn't we have to keep the aborted field to keep backwards compatibility?  Would we need to generate the protobuf files?  From what I understand this field is just used to pass information around (to the listener generating the logs), so I guess it probably isn't going to be necessary to be serialized (actually aborted node instances should not be serialized), but unless this aborted field was somehow excluded in protobuf marshalling, and/or cancelType will be too?
timeline.author: krisv

timeline.bodyText: It seems most of the logic around storying actual object was removed for more review, should this (and similar references in this PR to WithValueObject) still be here?
timeline.author: krisv

timeline.message: [JBPM-9129] Start process without triggering a start node

timeline.bodyText: Please remove auto-generated TODO comment for consistency across the class methods.
timeline.author: afalhambra

timeline.bodyText: Same as some others comments, it should be nodeIds to not lead to any confusion.
timeline.author: afalhambra
afalhambra
afalhambra

timeline.bodyText:
Previous version of this class setup this.aborted = true; when calling cancel() method. However this is no longer the case in the new changes. Shouldn't we set also this.aborted = true; when calling cancel() method? Otherwise aborted is never updated in the code (new method setAborted(boolean aborted) is not called in the code).
The reason to keep aborted field is to keep backward compatibility only? if so, why you want to mark cancelType as transient
timeline.author: afalhambra

replies.bodyText: Field aborted and cancelType aren't necessary to be persisted long-term, but more short-term for data passing.  Probably aborted could have been transient as well, but for backwards compability we probably can't change that now.  So I guess the plan is to just keep the field, nothing more.  I think we have tests that are run as part of QE suite that test portability of process instance binary state across versions, can we make sure these are run to make sure we don't break backwards compatibility with this?
replies.author: krisv

replies.bodyText:
Yes, there are tests as part of a test suite in jbpm-runtime-manager module. However these are related to a migration between different bpm processes. So I'm wondering whether this will be enough or we should add a specific test case for backward compatibility. @krisv, @elguardian wdyt?
https://github.com/kiegroup/jbpm/blob/master/jbpm-runtime-manager/src/test/java/org/jbpm/runtime/manager/impl/migration/MigrationManagerTest.java
replies.author: afalhambra

replies.bodyText: This aborted field would be persisted with any node instance, so I think any of those migration tests would be able to detect migration issues caused by this.  There should be sufficient other unit tests for simply testing whether aborting a node instance works well (using cancelType).
replies.author: krisv

timeline.bodyText:
Writing down here some comments about these bpmn files:

Name attribute in the processes should be consistent and meaningful. Some of them have "test2" and another has "test".
Package should be consistent and meaningful across them. Some have "com.myspace.sample" and others have "com.myspace.test"
timeline.author: afalhambra

+     * @throws DeploymentNotActiveException in case deployment with given deployment id is not active
+     */

timeline.message: [JBPM-9129] Start process without triggering a start node
[JBPM-9129] Start process without triggering a start node
